location: El Mirador > El Potrero Chico > Nuevo Leon > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: This is a really great route~ with awesome exposure and a really cool summit. It climbs obvious dihedrals and good face climbing up to the ridge.     P1: 5.10a - 11 bolts   P2: 5.10a - 9 bolts    P3: 5.10c - 9 bolts - crux. Some cool handjams and good exposure.    P4: 5.9 - 8 bolts - Jugs to the summit.     You can link pitches and do the route route in two pitches.
protection: 12 draws + 60m Rope   Take 22 draws if you want to link pitches.

location: Sugar Shack > Cougar Canyon (Creek) - CONSTRUCTION IN PROGRESS > Bow Valley > Alberta > Canada > North America > International
desc: from tabvar:     Cool fins to roof~ thin holds over roof.

location: The Hen House > Kamloops > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: A safe mixed route with a bit of run out up top. You should probably avoiding touching the large detached boulder to the right of the anchor. #7 on topo.

location: Pilon De Lolita > Loreto Area > Baja California Sur > Mexico > North America > International
desc: Start on a slab under a left leaning arched roof. Follow bolts up and left to the arete at the left hand side of the arching roof. Turn the roof and follow the bolts on the arete to a two bolt anchor at ledge.

location: The Courtyard > Mamquam FSR > Squamish > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Fun technical climbing. Tricky right off the bat.

location: The Dark Pool > Powell River > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Two potential starts. 1) Travers across canyon and start at the roof/down climb to ledge. 2) Swim over (bring your shoes and chalk and a towel) and start on ledge below roof. *True start = starting on this ledge. **Grade unconfirmed~ cleaned and climbed 3 years ago~ top may be dirty - fairly easy climb~ but interesting crux to turn the roof.     Climb passed the crux roof~ then continue slightly right and straight up.
protection: Free solo. Caution~ control your fall~ water can still hurt if you land wrong.

location: The Slabs > Bear Mountain (AKA Bald Hill) > New Brunswick > Canada > North America > International
desc: On the upper slabs there is a prominent black streak that narrows towards the top of the climb. Climb this black streak.

location: (a) Foreplay Left and Centre > Foreplay Cliff > (k) Evergreen Drive Crags > Skaha > Okanagan > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: If you miss the high left hold at crux~ the route seems much harder.

location: Los Chileros > San Isidro Canyon > Nuevo Leon > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: Climbs a crack.

location: (d) Doctors' Wall > (c) Doctors' Group > Skaha > Okanagan > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Easiest route that leads to the top of Doctor's Wall. Consistent 5.10 climbing with some nice moves and rests~ no surprise.   A single 70m is enough to rappel to the ground (over the boulders).
protection: 8 bolts to a chain anchor with a very nice ledge.

location: 06 - Dame nature > Montagne d'Argent > 15. Laurentians > Quebec > Canada > North America > International
desc: Interesting technical crux after the second bolt.  Crux intéressant et technique après le second ancrage.

location: Tight Canyon > Devil's Glen > Ontario South Bouldering and Rock > Ontario > Canada > North America > International
desc: Slab climb featuring finger cracks and several hidden finger pockets.

location: Las Agujas (The Spires) > El Potrero Chico > Nuevo Leon > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: Alternate second pitch for Crack Test Dummies. At the top of Crack Test Dummies pitch 1~ belay from the higher of two sets of anchors. Leaving the belay~ pull a couple moves off the belay following the left most set of bolts (the side of the Spire facing Mota Wall) Continue for approximately 100 feet utilizing an arete and face holds.  To finish stop on the ledge and climb the 12 foot "third pitch" of Crack Test Dummies OR (preferred) follow the last 3 bolts of Sunnyside Up to top out the Grande Spire.    Shares a couple bolts with Achtung Rheinstein Arete.

location: (g) The Corridor > (a) The Fortress > Skaha > Okanagan > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: A similar style to Genetic Mirror for the first half of the climb~ followed by a cool move over a roof and a thin slabby crux passing the final bolt.

location: La Lulu > La Huasteca > Nuevo Leon > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: No information

location: Into the Shade > Devil's Glen > Ontario South Bouldering and Rock > Ontario > Canada > North America > International
desc: Poorly protected cracks~ better avoided.  Unless you're into that sorta thing.

location: Tower of Power > Quarry Rock > Vancouver Area > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Start to the right and back to the left. Slabby~ crimpy~ and technical.
protection: 4 bolts with bolted anchors.   Shares anchor with Soul Vaccination.

location: (c) Grassy Glades > (h) Small Eastern Crags > Skaha > Okanagan > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: A burly 10c~ sustained the whole way up~ wanders a bit so keep your mind open to stepping right or left rather than always straight up.

location: Crow's Nest > Nova Scotia > Canada > North America > International
desc: This imposing route climbs the hand crack out of the right side of an obvious roof. After the roof~ throw yourself into the chimney slot and rest awhile. Challenges resume at the top of the chimney~ where steep finger and fist cracks lead to the top.
protection: Standard rack with doubles of hand size pieces. Glue-ins for anchor.

location: Latvian Ledge Area > Lion's Head > Ontario South Bouldering and Rock > Ontario > Canada > North America > International
desc: The right of the two cracks~ this often-wet route is nice when dry.

location: The Wall of Shadows > The Swamp > Ontario South Bouldering and Rock > Ontario > Canada > North America > International
desc: none listed

location: Bowen Island > Vancouver Area > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Far left side. The start of this route is tide dependent.

location: Upper Cat Wall > Cat Walls > Castlegar > Kootenays West > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: none listed

location: H. Folles > Lac du Cap > 14. Lanaudiere > Quebec > Canada > North America > International
desc: Beau 'face' vertical.   Plusieurs petits crux entrecoupés de courts repos.   Finale sous tension!
protection: 5 Bolts   Poignée de cams BD#.3 à #1   Relais équipé

location: Gardener's Wall > Grassi Lakes > Bow Valley > Alberta > Canada > North America > International
desc: About as comfortable as the name implies~ but still really fun climbing.  Good moves~ but the holds are a little sharp~ even for rockies limestone.

location: House of Cards > Cougar Canyon (Creek) - CONSTRUCTION IN PROGRESS > Bow Valley > Alberta > Canada > North America > International
desc: A good two pitch route that climbs easy stuff into harder stuff.     Pitch 1 (Slowpoke): 5.8 climbing a little left of a brown streak to a ledge. Continue through the dihedral and get to the anchor.    Pitch 2 (Fidget): 5.10c climbing on difficult and interesting stone.     Descent: lower to midway anchor and to the ground. Climbing 1 long pitch and bringing up a second may be the best way to climb this beast

location: X Wall > McQuirks Mountain > New Brunswick > Canada > North America > International
desc: There is a lot of variety packed into this long pitch.  An easy start~ a roof to surmount~ a long corner providing great stemming~ a short but tricky bolt protected traverse and to finish off this test of endurance - a burly crack section. Watch out for rope drag.
protection: Standard rack to 3".  Maybe double up from .5 to #1 camalots.  One bolt protects a techy traverse.  Bolted rappel stations get you to the ground.

location: 12. Arista Filo de Chuchilla > Mogote del Valle > Vinales > Cuba > North America > International
desc: A very nice 2 pitches route.  P1: Climb on super sharp rock up to a point where you have to traverse left. You will encounter a highline anchor~ but don't use it~ keep going to a ledge with a 2 bolt anchor.  P2: The money pitch!! Climb the arete to the top using good holds. The last part is runout but the climbing eases. If you get freaked out while on this pitch you can bail on Hara Kiri to your right.  Descent: Rappel the route or use an improbable trail (I have not look for it~ but the guidebook states it)

location: Leaning Tree Edge > South Peak Crags > Chinese Mountains > Quadra Island > Vancouver Island > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: This was probably the first route to be climbed as a 'rock climb' at Chinese Mountains~ top roped in 1997 by Phil Stone~ Greg Shea and Liam Edwards. It was climbing this route and discovering that these crags would take a major bolting effort to make a climbing area that delayed development for what turned out to be almost 20 years.     Great sustained climbing on positive holds with a strenuous mid-section. Start behind the leaning tree up steep~ clean grey rock to the left of a boulder-pinnacle to a thin crack in a left facing corner on a semi-detached (but solid) block. Climb over the block into a shallow corner on good holds to mantle onto a narrow black ledge halfway up. Step left on the ledge and then continue direct alongside the tree up a steep~ grinding wall. Pull onto a rest ledge and then a few easier moves to finish.

location: Ground Zero > Nuevo Bayamón > Puerto Rico > North America > International
desc: The body positioning combined with the great features on this climb made it our gem of the day.  As the local guide says~ it's a shame it's only 30 feet long!

location: La Discothèque > Mt Wells > Victoria > Vancouver Island > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: The bottom is definitely the crux. The route changes character above the 4th bolt. Quite powerful at the bottom.
protection: ~7 bolts. Shares chains with Two-Step. Well protected throughout the tough section.

location: Overhanging Wall > Metcalfe Rock > Ontario South Bouldering and Rock > Ontario > Canada > North America > International
desc: none listed

location: Sector 3 > Lake Amatitlan > Guatemala > North America > International
desc: 5 Bolts. Short but packs a punch

location: Merchants and Thieves Wall > Lion's Head > Ontario South Bouldering and Rock > Ontario > Canada > North America > International
desc: Namesake of the wall~ this mixed line starts down off the ledge of the previous routes.
protection: Mixed - bolts with medium sized gear useful.

location: Zombie Wall > DFO (The Skerries) > St John's Area > Avalon Peninsula > Newfoundland > Newfoundland and Labrador > Canada > North America > International
desc: Starts easy with a crux around halfway and a good rest before the finish.

location: Lost World > Nuevo Bayamón > Puerto Rico > North America > International
desc: Start by going up the overhang metal ladder.

location: Chachamuri Derecha > Rancho San Lorenzo > Basaseachi > Chihuahua > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: Revisar foto del topo para su localización.

location: Lower Virgin > Virgin Canyon > El Potrero Chico > Nuevo Leon > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: Move right at the third bolt on Trouble At The Border and finish at the anchors for Resurrection.

location: Hassler Crag > Northern BC > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Not a lot known about this route yet~ someone enlighten us!
protection: 2 top anchor bolts with chains~ 4 bolts along route~ gear to 2".

location: Escalera No. 3 > Parque Mirador del Sur > Dominican Republic > North America > International
desc: Esc 3
protection: 4 Stainless steel bolts 2 Stainless steel bolts with chain links on the top.

location: Ronin's Corner > The Smoke Bluffs > Squamish > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: The arete just right of Dreams of Passion.  This isn't as hard as Dreams~ but still requires tough friction moves between bolts spaced enough to keep it exciting.
protection: The first bolt is pretty high.  It used to be possible to pre-clip it by standing on a stump~ but the stump is now gone.  The first moves~ especially if you take the slab on the left~ could well be the crux~ and the base drops off right below the bolt so you risk a fifteen foot fall after only climbing ten feet.  All this suggests that stick-clipping is a very good idea~ but you may be able to climb MCM to the height of the bolt and traverse over to it.    Take a few nuts or small cams for the crack between the two slab sections.  There's a two-bolt anchor at the top of Dreams of Passion that works for this climb.

location: Tunnel Mountain > Banff National Park > Alberta > Canada > North America > International
desc: Climb up the steep face to the dihedral and move right onto the face.

location: Tower of Tails > Okanagan > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Move up the splitter slanting and overhanging hand crack and use the walls when necessary for friction (or purely jam the crack) since there aren't many footholds. Pull through the cruxy roof feature a little ways off the ground and enjoy the rest of the excellent jams. You can start at the very bottom of the crack for maximum fun~ or start on a ledge a little ways off the ground.
protection: SR with an extra BD #2 and #3 for comfort. Long slings if setting up a TR.

location: (c) The Prow > (c) Doctors' Group > Skaha > Okanagan > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: We found the (old) guidebook picture to be taken at an extremely odd angle that was less then helpful. New guidebook pictures are spot on.  P1: 5.10b. Start up a corner with fun stemming leading to an intimidating looking roof/undercling out right and up. After the roof climb up the corner until arriving at the belay on your right. Quality pitch. Gear to #3BD C4  P2: 5.10c. Trending up and slightly right from the belay. Do not continue up the same corner system as P1.
protection: Gear to 3". Extras in the small cams/stoppers may be needed for p2/

location: Amphitheatre > Mount Maxwell > Salt Spring Island > Strait of Georgia > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: P1: Dihedral cimbing near a tree to slab in the middle. Using the tree brings the rating down at least a few letter grades. P2 is easier (5.9) face climbing.

location: Casino Wall > Cougar Canyon (Creek) - CONSTRUCTION IN PROGRESS > Bow Valley > Alberta > Canada > North America > International
desc: Slab climbing as for "Loaded Dice" and then continue to the roofs above. Good climbing and somewhat pumpy. Stay on your toes!

route: So! Maybe You Need a Lesson in Humility!
location: Lady Slipper Wall > Lion's Head > Ontario South Bouldering and Rock > Ontario > Canada > North America > International
desc: Just left of Kung-Fu~ this route has a lot of fragile and very loose rock at the beginning.

location: Médicos > La Huasteca > Nuevo Leon > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: No information

location: Bichuflinqui > Nuevo Bayamón > Puerto Rico > North America > International
desc: Overhung and fun

location: Snowbound > Terrace > Northern BC > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: An interesting climb with many holds to choose from. Climb slightly right ofSpruce Leeup the face through a big pocket to a large ledge with anchors.

location: Creekside > Cougar Canyon (Creek) - CONSTRUCTION IN PROGRESS > Bow Valley > Alberta > Canada > North America > International
desc: Use some cheater stones to get over the wet slippery rock and head up and traverse right towards a small roof

location: Centre Stage > The Amphitheater > KLO Creek > Okanagan > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Hard for the grade~ not because of the movement~ but because it is difficult to read and sequenced in some of those places! I would advise stick clipping the first 2 bolts~ there is a crux right off the ground~ and while the first bolt protects it~ a fall is not particularly kind to your belayer here.  Head straight up the first couple of bolts before traversing hard left. Head straight up a couple more bolts and then traverse under the large roof hard right. Pull the roof at the weakness~ then the line should be easy to follow for the remainder as bolts are visible.   After you pull the first roof~ the next bolt is heady~ but safe. There are a couple more bolts like that up higher~ with the crux coming at the next bulge.
protection: 11 bolts~ 2 bolt anchor with a locking steel biner

location: E. Black&White - Club Sandwich > Weir > 15. Laurentians > Quebec > Canada > North America > International
desc: P1~ 5.10   Large vertical crack~ often wet~ followed by a small horizontal crack then up to the Vire a Bicyclette.   P2~ 5.10+   Starts in Le Grand Bill and traverses right in a small dihedral~ same exit as Le Grand Bill.    Possibility to exit by traversing left at the belay to a small dihedral to the top.    Originally done all trad~ the bolts were added for Le Grand Bill.

location: The Dihedrals > El Potrero Chico > Nuevo Leon > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: This route climbs the moss-layered left-facing dihedral on the right side of the gully. Underneath the moss...choss. Might be the dirtiest  pitch in all of EPC...and I do love my choss (except for this one). Beware of breaking holds higher up where the rock begins to disintegrate. The current anchor is an American Death Triangle on the ledge so bring webbing to replace it if you actually finish the route. I didn't care to finish...and probably no one else ever has either. 5.10+ rating is estimated if the route was clean of moss and rotten rock.

location: Los Mosqueteros > El Reliz / Cerro de las viboras > Sonora > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: Pasos interesantes y comprometedores te llevan al hoyo donde cabes parado que esta como a 3/4 de ruta~ sales del hoyo con cuidado~ para terminar en una chimenea/grieta. Al final puedes irte por la grieta o por fuera a la izquierda.

location: 2 Mur des Gauchistes > c. Central Area > Lac Long > 03. Quebec City, Charlevoix, Portneuf > Quebec > Canada > North America > International
desc: Starts with a very high glue-in (stick-clip). Link the small dihedrals (cams and glue-ins) to a biggish roof~ then continue straight on the face to the belay (glue-ins).  Départ avec un premier scellement très haut (stick-clip). Enchainer des petits dièdres jusqu’au toit (mécaniques et scellements)~ ensuite continuer tout droit sur la face jusqu’au relais (scellements).

location: La Palma (The Palm) Sport > El Salto > Nuevo Leon > Northern Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: very left side  route f the cave.
protection: fixed binners in the anchor for  lowering

location: Lower Bear > Bear Country > KLO Creek > Okanagan > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Unrelenting pump fest all the way to the big move at the top

location: Mont de l'Enfer > Hautes-Gorges-de-la-Rivière-Malbaie > 03. Quebec City, Charlevoix, Portneuf > Quebec > Canada > North America > International
desc: Nice route. Crux is at beginning of pitch two. A Short tree bolts protected slab which may be aided easily. The fourth pitch has a splitter arch which is a contender for some of the best quality climbing Quebec has to offer .
protection: Belays are on bolts and some on pro. Normal rack up to number 3

location: The Far Right > White Buddha > Alberta > Canada > North America > International
desc: Get to the ledge and work your way up the clean grey face on nice holds

location: Chanchullo/El Chonta > Chontalcoatlan > Central Mexico > Mexico > North America > International
desc: This is one of the bolted routes on the slab/face to the left side of the Reina del Sur sector. The crux is going over a small roof with a tiny crack and bad foot/hand holds.

location: Neat and Cool > The Smoke Bluffs > Squamish > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: To the right of the Stumps crack.  Three bolts leading up the middle face.  Passing the second bolt appears to be the crux with thin slab moves gaining the thin crack cutout feature above the bolt.  From there move up into the xenolithic section above (much easier).  The rating depends greatly on how much you stay or stray from the bolt line to use the crack on the right.  I don't have any primary information about the development of this route.  If anyone has that info please let me know and I'll update it accordingly.  Thanks.

location: Gumby's Wall > The Smoke Bluffs > Squamish > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: At the far right of the wall~ a lone bolt protects a shallow corner~ above the big horizontal~ with a few small discontinuous face cracks.     The actual start of this climb is unknown~ it could be the crack start of Pokey's Variation or it could be the large corner.

location: Cerro Quemado > Guatemala > North America > International
desc: To the right of La Competencia and begins with a fun little roof. First clip and crux is to a chain that dangles over the opening roof... Do not fall. After navigating the roof prepare for a long bit of balancy slabby climbing.
protection: 60 meter rope~ bolts~ chain anchors at the top

location: Left Centre > Roche Lake > Kamloops > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Climb the chimney to a pair of bolts

location: Sérénité > 14. Lanaudiere > Quebec > Canada > North America > International
desc: A variation that avoids the low crux of its right neighbour~ but still enable the climber to experience the balancy slab. Keep some juice for the physical exit.  Variante qui évite le crux de sa voisine de droite~ mais permet de grimper sa portion dalleuse intéressante. Gardez-vous de l’énergie pour la sortie exigeante.

location: Carag-Dur > Eldred Valley > Powell River > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Veggie Tales is one of the few completely gear-protected routes in the Eldred Valley. Three pitches of engaging~ varying styles make a pleasant 3 pitch 5.10(+) outing. Pitches 1 & 3 feature exciting cruxes protected by small~ but bomber gear.  P1: A slippery left-leaning corner edged by unique quartz dykes wakes the leader up right off the deck. Excellent~ thoughtful 5.10 crack/corner work leads into a long 5.8 stembox. This corner was the inspiration for the routes name~ as it was once buried under a 15m tall~ 2m deep garden of dirt. 5.10c . 35m. 2 bolt anchor.  P2: Pull the tiny roof left of the belay and follow the flared hand cracks to a ledge. The rock improves here and is remniscent of Squamish for a moment. Fun finger cracks lead to the belay. 5.8 25m. 2 bolt anchor.  P3: C0 Pendulum left of the belay towards the tree stump. A splitter finger crack with one crux bulge keeps you honest before the easier fingerlocks appear.   Descent: Rap the route.
protection: DR .3"-3"~ S-4"~ a couple small wires~ 1x70m rope

location: Brunser Area > Murrin Park > Squamish > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Technical thin crack that feels pretty desperate at times. Nice and sustained difficulty from midway to the anchors. The holds are never quite as big as you'd like and the gear's a little fiddly and spaced.
protection: Finger-sized gear~ you could get a #2 up top but the business is blue Metolius to purple Camalots. Chains at the top.

location: East Wall Trail > Harrison Bluffs > Fraser Valley > British Columbia > Canada > North America > International
desc: Climb over the low roof left of Red Pill and then straight up the face on potato chip edges. Move right at the top to the Red Pill anchor

location: Upper Cove > Bowman Valley > Bowman/Emeralds > I-80 Corridor > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Steepest climb at the Upper Cove~good holds and fun movement~ if only it was longer!    50 more seconds of fun filled rock throwing guy~ you know who you are.
protection: Bolts. Equipped for lower off or rap

route: 589 (Per Clint Cummins Guide Book) Unknown (Per Sloan Guide Book)
location: Reed's Pinnacle > p. Reed's Pinnacle Area > Lower Merced River Canyon > Yosemite Valley > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: A short and fun climb that with the right beta will be cruiser and the wrong beta will make it seem two grades harder.  Start with good fingers or hands before the climb opens up to uncomfortable offwidth (the hard beta) or a lie-back to the first ledge.  Fun stemming up to the chimney for some more comfortable but unprotectable stemming to the anchors.
protection: This climb eats gear. Standard rack.

location: North Slope > Lake Ramona > North San Diego County > San Diego County > California
desc: Low start below thick brush then into a thin~ left leaning tips crack.  Easy topout.

location: Clock Rock > Benton Crags > Eastern Hills > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Follow the upward left diagonal ramp~ then climb up a short headwall and over a lip to a prominent plate/chickenhead.  Continue up the slab past a thin horizontal crack (pin) to the anchor. The overall climbing is relatively easy~ but pro is generally sparse and thin.  A decent climb if you want to get in a bit more mileage for the grade~ otherwise a little on the chossy side.
protection: Small rack of mostly thin gear~ one pin~ bolted anchor (shared with 'Here's To The Good Stuff')

location: Middle Tier (Right Side) > Middle Tier > Frustration Creek > Highway 38 Crags > San Bernardino Mountains > California
desc: fun climbing to a roof in a left facing dihedral. continue up steep rock.

location: Hemingway Buttress (East Face Center) > Hemingway Buttress > Lost Horse Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This short route climbs an obvious crack system on the right side of the wall.  It is a fairly nice finger and hand crack~ with adequate protection.

route: ??? ["Kung Fu Panda"- is not original name]
location: Lower Cathedral Rock > Lower Cathedral Area > Valley South Side > Yosemite Valley > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: The route climbs better than it looks.   location - 10 feet left from "Mac Daddy 11a" thin crack system in the corner goes up to set of new bolts.
protection: double from green alien to #1 camalot

location: Siberia > Outer Mongolia > The Middle Kingdom > Wonderland North > Wonderland of Rocks > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: Start to the right of "Randy"~ in a low angle ramp-like section~ then climb steeper plates (some loose)~ past a fixed pin and seven bolts.   This angles up and right to the first belay of "Love Gas". Rappel (60 meter meter rope~ 70 meter is better) or continue up "Love Gas" and Rappel.

route: A Danger to Ourselves and Others
location: Area 13 - Left Side > Area 13 > Clark Canyon > Mammoth Lakes Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: This route is a fun jug hauling romp across Area 13 for when you are just looking for something a little different or simply want the juggy pockets never to end.    It starts on the route Exqueeze Me and ends on Inyo Face. The pitches are all kept short because of serious rope drag in crossing aretes and traversing alcoves. Because Area 13 is a very popular crag and this route traverses pretty much every route on it~ it can only be recommended to be climbed midweek or with utmost consideration for other parties.   Pitch 1 - Starting on Exqueeze Me~ traverse right and up clipping the 2nd or 3rd bolts of the routes crossed. Aim for the point where the route Ugly~ Fat~ Mean~ Come to Mammoth~ Be a Queen transfers from the blocky face to the arete. Thin slab climbing (the technical crux) from this point leads up and right to the belay ledge halfway up Wild Will's Arete.   Pitch 2 - Stem and flake climbing leads straight up from the belay to a bolt. Traverse right from here around the arete and onto the face. Level traversing around the alcove leads to a couple exciting moves getting to a sloping ledge and the belay for Borrowing From Tradition.   Pitch 3 - Level traversing right~ moving up where harder~ leads to a long right slanting crack. Follow this crack to a large ledge. Belay from the ledge with a gear anchor.   Pitch 4 - Exciting but easy moves off the belay slightly down and right (harder for the follower) leads to easy face climbing trending up and to the right. Belay on a ledge with a horizontal crack just above it. This ledge is located about 5 feet above the anchors for Demasiado.   Pitch 5 - Fun juggy face climbing up and right leads to the prominent buttress of Inyo Face. Climb this to the top.
protection: The protection on this climb is mostly bolts with gear in between routes. The recommended rack is a single rack from .3 to 3~ a set of nuts~ and 12 draws where at least half of the draws are extendable alpine draws.

route: A Day At The Pod Races
location: Jabba > Tatooine > Fairview Mountain > Apple Valley Crags > High Desert > California
desc: Clip a low first bolt and pull up on jugs.  Continue up and left clipping closely spaced bolts.

location: The Upper Tier > Echo Cliffs > Santa Monica Mountains > Los Angeles Basin > California
desc: Blackie climbs up the right side of the face~ left of the crack/gully~ and 30 feet left of "Welcome to Echo." Begin climbing below an arching~ left facing~ crescent shaped flake where the rock changes from tan to black. Climb up the flake on side-pulls~ edges~ and small pockets on wonderful black rock. From the top of the flake move up and right on horizontals and pockets. Higher pull through a bulge and continue to the top~ and the anchor~ on positive edges and pockets.

location: Black Face > Echo Cliffs > Santa Monica Mountains > Los Angeles Basin > California
desc: This climb has positive edges the whole way (thanks somewhat to the massive amount of glue employed to keep the holds in place . . .).  It starts steep~ then eases for a bit before steepening up again at the end.

location: Wheeler Gorge - East Gully (aka "Cobble Choss") > Hwy 33/Ojai > Central Coast > California
desc: Highest route in the gully. Shares an anchor with the route to the right.

location: Holy Trinity > Upper Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Cruxes at left leaning section 1st half (tippy and awkward) and below the transition from crack to flake near the top. Remarkable finger locks and holds near the top.

location: Higher Cathedral Rock > Cathedral Spires Area > Valley South Side > Yosemite Valley > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: This is a fun and adventurous climbs up the outside face to the left of Braille Book. The climb consists almost entirely of face climbing on big knobs and features~ with occasional crack systems for pro. There are no bolts on Blind Man's Bluff~ which makes the route finding and protection the main challenges of the climb. The climb feels a bit like The Flakes on MCR~ but shorter and not quite as good.    About 20ft left of the start of Braille Book is an outside corner with a large system of detached flakes resting against the wall. Begin by scrambling up the flakes (mind the loose rock) to reach a point beneath and to the right of a prominent roof. Climb an offwidth crack to the right of the roof and then stem across to traverse left just a few feet above the lip. Follow a crack system angling up and left to reach a half-driven pin. Tie off the pin and make a couple 5.8 moves traversing left to gain another crack system. Climb up the left side of a sort of rotten flake to reach a stance with a horizontal crack for an anchor (2-3"). This is a long pitch and has potential for very bad rope drag if you place gear in the wrong places.    The second pitch begins with a steep flake above the anchor~ then follows a corner system (5.9). After the corner wander up the face (runout)~ aiming for another left facing corner and roof. Move past the roof and climb easy terrain to a ledge atop some pinnacles and chockstones.    Pitch three climbs up beneath the bulge~ then traverses left before finally pulling over. Climb the arete to the right of a roof. At this point there's probably several ways to finish. I continued up and left to a bolted anchor with mussy-hooks (I think part of Remain In Light)~ then climbed up and right through some sort of loose flakes. This takes you big ledges and a tree where you join up with Braille Book and every other route in the area.    Climb the final 5.4 pitch of Braille Book to finish. Use the standard walk off to descend.

location: The Crane > The Crane > Cougar Buttes > High Desert > California
desc: Crux is the upper half of climb on thin plates.

location: Eagle Lake Cliff > Eagle Creek Canyon > West Shore > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: 30' right of "Crackula" is a right facing corner.   Climb double cracks to a roof and follow a wide crack over the roof.

location: 1. Northeast Face > Calaveras Dome > Calaveras Domes > Carson Pass Highway (88) > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Start up the large wide left facing offwidth to the Right of Rastaman Vibrations and the Hyena Arch. Undercling a small overhang until you can establish yourself in the gradually widening offwidth above. Two bolt anchor on top of the Blockhead pillar.

location: Moderate Crag > Lucerne Limestone > High Desert > California
desc: 1st route on the left side of the Moderate Crag.  Go up the vertical clean section of rock between the arete on the left and a crack on the right.

location: Twin Towers > Tatooine > Fairview Mountain > Apple Valley Crags > High Desert > California
desc: Cruiser moves followed by a brief few move crux sequence.
protection: Shares anchors with 5.7 Flying Debris.  3 bolts.

location: The Tortuga > The Galapagos > Geology Tour Road > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This is the ramp/chimney witht the two bolts on the East face of the Tortuga.
protection: small to large plus a couple of QDs for the two bolts.

location: Rob's Rock > Inner Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: A great off-vertical face climb with excellent movement.

location: Dome Rock > The Needles / Kern River > Southern Sierra > California
desc: 1st pitch: Start immediately to the right of Tobin's Dihedral and stay close to it's edge. Come ready to place oppositional nuts in horizontals~ tie off chickheads and clip a few bolts.     2nd pitch: Continue up the corner/crack of Tobin's. You can break out right on the face and clip bolts or continue until corner runs out.    3rd pitch: Continue up the face clipping bolts. Climbing gets easier the higher you get.
protection: Assortment of small to large stoppers with matching cams~ tie off slings for chickenheads and draws

location: The Dollar Store > The Benches > The Emeralds > Bowman/Emeralds > I-80 Corridor > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: none listed
protection: 9 bolts long to mussies a few feet right of the ring anchors on Push to Open.

location: Echo Rock - E Face (Left) > Echo Rock - East Face > Echo Rock > Echo Rock Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This climb has a fun roof and thin face above.  It is loose near the start.

location: Train Time Wall > Donner Summit > I-80 Corridor > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Head up the slightly overhung face on positive hand and foot holds.    Clip the bolt and continue up the crack systems.  Work your way up the corner on the right and wandering finger crack on the left to a ledge 2/3 of the way to the top.    Utilize the horizontal crack for a last chance pro/cam placement before heading up the final slab to the anchors.
protection: 1 bolt~ single rack to 2" (bring some small stuff for the finger crack)

location: Kidding Area > Lower Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Long and varied. Start with a hand-jam below a steep face. Climb to a transition left & follow an easy slab back right to a short~ steep face. A  thin slab finish leads to the anchors.  *There are several transitions (potential for rope drag)~ be aware of where the rope runs. Extendo draws help. At the top of the slab w/the large boulder~ flip your rope out of the crack before continuing up to reduce drag.*
protection: 13 bolts~ steel 'biner anchors.  Pull rope from right side of platform.

location: Castro Mesa Buttress > Santa Monica Mountains > Los Angeles Basin > California
desc: Face start leads up to finger crack that gradually widens to a last bit of hands at very top.  Soft sandstone~ i.e.~ over-protect accordingly~ and beware of flexing face holds.
protection: Pro to 2.5"~ gear anchor.  Descend by going around the backside of the summit block and downclimbing the 5.easy rippled slab off of the shoulder of the prominent buttress to climber's right.

location: Echo Rock - West Face > Echo Rock > Echo Rock Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This route is around to the right from the main concentration of routes on the southwest face of Echo Rock.  It is therefore less crowded than the routes to its left.  It's about 80 feet to the right of the big Eff Four gully.  Climb straight up to the top.

location: Conan's Corridor > Jumbo Rock Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: Colorado Crack is THE climb to do in the greater Jumbo Rocks area.    This 100' crack lies in the middle of the Corridor Face just right of Spiderman and is right-angling at the bottom~ then vertical to the top. Face climb past large huecos to the right-angling hand crack. Continue up a vertical finger crack with nice face holds on exquisite rock.    Anchor: natural gear.    To descend~ scramble off to the north (climber's right).  This involves a move or two of downclimbing or...take DE's advice: "bring a skateboard for the descent~ you might have to ollie the six inch bump encountered halfway down".
protection: Medium to large nuts~ a double set of cams .5 to 2"~ plus one 3" piece; skateboard optional.

location: Gotham City > Upper Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Climb up face into a crack. After the fifth bolt you end up at a good rest where you traverse left on some slab. Finish at a two bolt anchor.

location: Wimovi Pluton > Southern Sierra > California
desc: Climb the corner between the ledge at the end of the wall and the ramp on the wall past a bolt to a bulge feature in the middle of the wall and follow 2 more bolts up passing some dike crystals then follow the upper easy ramp to anchors.

location: Dozier Dome > Tuolumne Meadows > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: Dozier Dihedral is the right facing corner on the right side of Dozier Dome.  Layback and smear to a small roof.

location: Bighorn Wall > Scheelite Canyon / Pratt's Crack Gully > Pine Creek Canyon > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Scramble up the easy ramp (5.5~ optional gear) for 30 feet to get to the first bolt. Tricky moves past the third bolt lead to an easy middle section and a final crux getting to the anchor.
protection: 8 Bolts~ Optional gear to 3"    Fixed anchor at the top.

location: Locker Memorial Face > Giant Rock > High Desert > California
desc: The Crux is right at the second Bolt

location: Dragon Breath Wall > The Coven > Big Bear North > Big Bear Lake Area > San Bernardino Mountains > California
desc: Just right of The Altar and an obvious wide crack is this short but engaging face.    Positive edges down low lead to an enjoyable finish on incut patina plates. Nothing but bolt hangers at the anchor~ so walk/scramble off to the right.

location: Dragon's Nest > Donner Summit > I-80 Corridor > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Climb a splitter layback for about 15'~ move right~ then move back left around a wide area. Continue up the hands to finger crack with small feet on the right face.  This route is listed in the Jackson guide as a 5.8~ unknown name or FA. Still a bit gritty but should clean up nicely - I thought it was more 5.9~ maybe it will get easier with traffic. I doubt anyone ever named it~ so I gave it one.

location: Wimovi Pluton > Southern Sierra > California
desc: Follow the 25' larger ramp corner in the middle of the base up to an angling ledge. From here continue up bolts and good hole features to the finish or just cut out right to some anchors.
protection: Bolts and a few pieces of gear

location: Roshambo Ledge > Ramona Wall > Poway Crags > North San Diego County > San Diego County > California
desc: Balancy face climbing leads to an easier slab above.  A fun route that can be knocked off fairly quickly before rapping off the ledge.

location: Schlitz Pillars > Leisure World > Rattlesnake Wash Hillside > Rattlesnake Canyon > Indian Cove > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: A steep start on knobs (crux) soon gives way to easier climbing as the angle kicks back on the upper portion of the route.

location: Bovine Dome > Stirrup Tank > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: A low quality hand crack with a very short hard section.
protection: A few pieces of gear~ or solo it.

location: Crag Full of Dynamite > Santa Barbara > Central Coast > California
desc: The bolted line immediately left of "The Good~the Bad and the Ugly."  Moderate climbing on interesting holds leads to a clear crux just before the chains.   This crux involves a very subtle and reachy slab move with the bolt at your feet.

location: Swidgeteria, The > Roadside Rocks > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: Tricky fingertip liebacking leads to a clean~ strenuous hand crack near the top

location: Hemingway Buttress (East Face Right) > Hemingway Buttress > Lost Horse Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: Left of Head Over Heals lie two 5.9 "Poodle" routes~ A Farewell To Poodles and For Whom The Poodle Tolls. FWTPT is a fun route; a little grainy~ but worth doing if in the area.  Bartlett gives it a "PG" rating~ but I felt it protected fine.  The descent down gully to climber's left involves a move or two of 5.3 downclimbing around a large boulder.

location: Great Wall of China > Central Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: To the right of Heart of the Sun.  Short but worth a tick while you wait.  The first moves require a thought and then cruiser to the anchor.

location: Gas and Electric Crag > Bowman Valley > Bowman/Emeralds > I-80 Corridor > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Climb blocky holds and pinch fins up a water streak groove like crack.

location: Split Rock > Sugarloaf Area > Highway 50 Corridor > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Fossilmax is the right hand bolt line on the west side of split rock~ immediately left of the chimney.
protection: 9 bolts to a single bolted anchor (with rap chains) shared with TriTip.

location: The Fox Head > Fox Canyon > Shelf Ridge > Hwy 33/Ojai > Central Coast > California
desc: Crack and seam left of 'Fox Head Aréte'.   A couple great finger locks midway then it's good edges to the top.
protection: Although gear could be placed halfway~ the short height makes this a good solo.

location: Upper Elbow Room > Upper Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: crux is after fourth bolt.

location: Bedrock Wall > The Land That Time Forgot > New Jack City > High Desert > California
desc: Boulder-like crux start at the first bolt. Well protected and fun!

location: Headstone Rock > Ryan Campground > Sheep Pass Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This is the leftmost of two short cracks that can be found on the north aspect of the boulder pile surrounding Headstone Rock.  They are both worthwhile short trad climbs~ and are shady on a sunny day.  Both sides of the crack are lined with grippy pinches and edges.  About the same difficulty as Headstone Crack Right.
protection: Light rack; single bolt up top for toproping.  Descent is a scramble off to the left.

location: Headstone Rock > Ryan Campground > Sheep Pass Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This is the rightmost of two short cracks that can be found on the north aspect of the boulder pile surrounding Headstone Rock.  They are both worthwhile short trad climbs~ and are shady on a sunny day.  About the same difficulty as Headstone Crack Left.
protection: Light rack; single bolt up top for toproping.  Descent is a scramble off to the left.

location: Main Slab > Big Rock Area > Inland Empire > California
desc: This is the last bolted line on the far right side of Big Rock~ about 10 feet right of False Headwall. Although not a true sport climb~ the crux is well-protected and after that it's bolted well enough. The climb gets its name from the vertical start~ involving some delicate moves on thin holds to reach the first bolt. The bolt protects a similar sequence of moves. Above this~ the route goes very easy on low angle slab with plenty of flakes for the hands and feet.   Due to the nature of this climb~ one star out of four. But it is well worth doing for the dicey opening moves. Rappel to descend.

location: Alley Wall > Gray Eagle > Shuteye Creek Area > Shuteye Ridge > Southern Sierra > California
desc: P1 - Either climb directly up the face to the left facing crack/arête or use the wide flake on the left to get off the ground and then traverse right.  Using the crack in the corner for pro~ head for the small roof above.  Bouldery moves surmount the roof and lead past a second bolt.  From here~ head up easy knobs past the left side of the larger roof above.  Finishes on a good ledge with bolts.    P2 - Curve left (easier climbing and better pro) before aiming for the obvious semi-circular hole in the roof directly above the belay.  Face climbing leads to the hole and a bolt just beyond it.  Head for the top on easier ground. Descent Head left and find the chain anchors for Control Your Pipe.  From here~ three single rope raps (watch your rope - lots of features to try and eat them) lead back to the base.  Otherwise~ continue for a short pitch up the face or take the gully on the left side wit a fixed rope.  From the summit~ rap the Great Depression.
protection: Gear to 4" (emphasis on small)~ knob slings

location: Left Over Bun > Sugarloaf Area > Highway 50 Corridor > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Start on a vertical crack on the the right side of a sharp heart-shaped flake. Mantle to a ledge. Ascend a ramp in a left-facing dihedral. Get up the short final headwall by a harder direct line~ or an easy wandering one.
protection: A few pieces from your trad rack. Bolted anchors of recent vintage at the top~ with rap rings.

location: Great Wall of China > Central Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Amazing vertical face that gets harder the higher you go.

location: Big Face > LTA > Sonora Pass Highway (108) > California
desc: AKA “Book of Dread.” 140ft to gear anchor. Starts on broken face and easy ledges and moves into right facing dihedral with hand sized crack. Protects well. Short easy chimney/offwidth at top that can be avoided by climbing face to the right. Save larger gear for protecting inside the offwidth. Intermediate 3 bolt anchor allows this to be done in two pitches. This route is particularly prone to small rock fall directly onto the belayer. Wear helmets and be careful of loose rock.
protection: Gear to #4. 3 bolt anchor mid-way. Gear anchor at top.

location: Hunk Rock - East Face > Hunk Rock > Barker Dam Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This route starts on the east face of Hunk Rock and turns the left corner to finish up the unprotected south face. A serious fall could occur here after running it out past the first and only bolt on the route. If you're solid at the grade~ there should be no problem as the bolt is placed at the crux of the route. The rock quality begins to degrade as you near the summit.
protection: Bring a selection of cams to make a belay at the top and 1 full length QD for the 1 bolt on the route.

location: Little Sister Spire > The Sisters > East Side > Pinnacles National Park > Central Coast > California
desc: The route is on the south arete of Little Sister Spire. Start on the south side of the Sisters as for Third Sister Approach ledge.
protection: Start up a slab past three bolts to gain the south arete~ continue uo the arete for more bolts. Seven bolts total

location: Sunshine Wall > Horseshoe Lake Area > Mammoth Lakes Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Climb the slab passing the first 3 bolts up to a mantle move onto a funky quartz dike.   From the dike move up the steepening face to reach a pocketed flake.    Follow the flake until possible to move right onto the face and continue directly up onto the easy angled slab to finish.
protection: 7 bolts~ double ring anchors (equipped with Mussy Hooks).

location: The Hot Tub > Steve Canyon Area > The Outback > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This is the bolted face route just right of The Dharma Bums (5.8)~ and climbs past several horizontals and 5 bolts to a bolted anchor atop the formation. Two stars out of five.

location: Lower Tier > Boy Scout Rocks > Mount Diablo State Park > San Francisco Bay Area > California
desc: A decent face route with some interesting moves. Apparently the most-wanted route in the area but I can't imagine why... The actual climbing on "Amazing Face" is pretty average~ but you get a great view between your heels in the upper part of the climb. P.S.- The belayer gets two points for dropping a falling climber into either of the man-eating holes at the bottom of the route.
protection: Eleven bolts lead to a bolted anchor with chains. Another anchor exists on top to allow climbers to safely rappel to the lower chains for top roping. Please use the lower chain anchor for top roping and lowering to stop the rope scaring and grooves left behind in the soft rock.     Please use your own gear for top roping off the chains to minimize wear on the expensive fixed gear~ and NEVER thread a rope through the eye of a glue in bolt for any reason but an unavoidable emergency.

location: Crichton Crag > West-Bound Crags > Western Carousel > New Jack City > High Desert > California
desc: Match start on crimp ledge. Move into the wide-crack/offwidth then continue left up bolt line onto the face~ continuing up and over the bulge. Grade may flux depending on the use of that rear/right-of-crack formation. Crux is getting through the wide crack and onto the face. Mind the chockstone(s).
protection: 4 bolts to anchors.   Shares anchors with Mosquito.

location: Nazgul Wall > Mariuolumne Dome > Tuolumne Meadows > Yosemite National Park > California
The Mine Shaft > Pinnacles West > Holcomb Valley Pinnacles > Big Bear North > Big Bear Lake Area > San Bernardino Mountains > California
desc: Step off a block to pass a horizontal crack and a bolt and mantle onto a sloping ledge. Clip a high bolt and then slither up the narrow rib to a slabby crux passing the last bolt.

location: Tourist Trap > East Side > Pinnacles National Park > Central Coast > California
desc: Climb just right of the arete at the farthest left of the Tourist Trap formation.
protection: Two bolts to a two-bolt anchor.

location: Lower Falls Amphitheater > Yosemite Falls Area > Valley North Side > Yosemite Valley > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: An arete route that starts with face moves. Traverse up and left for the first bolt. Make a mantle move~ then up and right to gain arete. Use gear between first and second bolt. Route finishes on sustained arete moves.  You can top rope this route after leading the 5.6 crack plus a few moves up and left

location: East Face > Green Dome > Santa Barbara > Central Coast > California
desc: Starts just right of the shallow alcove and just left of the overhanging Dancing Fingers~ Anti-Bro trends up and right.
protection: 4 bolts~ runout at the top. Sparkling anchors (shares with Dancing Fingers)

location: Dome Rock > The Needles / Kern River > Southern Sierra > California
desc: P1 (5.5):  Start as for Tree Route.  From atop the large Pine Tree~ locate a 2-3" crack and follow it up and left.  (Alternately~ start on the bolted face to the left of Tree Route.) Belay from a shallow horizontal ledge at the start of a stunning finger crack.    P2 (5.9+ sustained):  Truly classic!!  Follow a left-leaning finger crack that arcs left along a clean slab.  The crack starts as solid fingers and slowly tapers down to nothing.  Take the time to find decent~ sloping footholds out to the left.  The crack takes many TCUs & small stoppers.  As the crack tapers and disappears~ face climb up and left to a hanging-belay from bolts.      P3 (5.10a):  Step left and follow an obvious left-facing dihedral.  As the corner curves to the right~ the crack in the dihedral diminishes.  The final 30 feet is the crux and requires small TCUs & stoppers.  Belay from the 3-bolt anchor atop Tree Route's 3rd pitch.    P4 (5.6):  Follow the final pitch of the Tree Route to a belay beneath an obvious horizontal crack.
protection: Standard rack with extra TCUs & small Stoppers.

location: The Moonstone > West Wonderland Valley > Wonderland Valley > Wonderland South > Wonderland of Rocks > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: Go up a long~ left slanting ramp/flake to its top. Face climb left past two bolts (crux) then up to the top.
protection: Two bolts~ standard trad gear should protect the climb.

location: One Of These Days Buttress > Cloudburst Canyon > Woodfords Canyon > Carson Pass Highway (88) > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: An obvious finger crack with locker finger pods leads up to a surprise undercling and then some chimney moves before heading right to the shared Little Miss Manners anchors.
protection: Small cams to #3 camalot. Medium stoppers.

location: Mammoth Crest > Mammoth Lakes Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Fun finger and thin hands crack that leads to some good face holds out left.  At this point traverse left to a ledge and pass two bolts to the anchor of the Hex Route.  Not quite as clean as the Hex Route but still fun climbing.  Easy TR from Hex Route anchor.

location: Doda Dome > Daff Area > Tuolumne Meadows > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: Climb up the low grade slab with some gear to the right and set up an anchor in the middle of the ledge. From there get to the thin crack in the white rock just to the left of the cave. The crux is getting up the short crack~ followed by some awkwardness to get around and up to the good but mossy hand jams above. Belay from above the roof or finish it off.

location: Highlands Wall > Crystal Crag > Mammoth Lakes Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Climb a shallow left facing corner~ until tricky moves passed a quartz dike.   After this very exposed climbing follows up a stepped arete to the anchors.
protection: 10 bolts~ Rappel Bolt and Chain anchor

location: Banana Belt > Central Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Starts up Rim Job but breaks right after the fourth bolt along a flake-like feature~ then traverses back left to the anchors of Rim Job.

location: North Dallas 40 > Texas Canyon > Angeles National Forest > Los Angeles Basin > California
desc: none listed

location: Twin Crags > Truckee River Canyon > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Crack just to the right of "Jamolator"~ a bolted 5.12.  Pull a small roof ~25 feet up~ head slightly left to anchors shared with "Jamolator" and "Nipples That Cut Glass".

location: Pea Brain > East Wonderland Valley > Wonderland Valley > Wonderland South > Wonderland of Rocks > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: Boulder high onto the base of the Pea Brain for the start of the route.    The first bolt isn't immediately visible~ so don't panic as you eyeball the second.      Work your way up easy shelves to the first bolt.  Continue through bolts 2 and 3 on the somewhat crispy face.  The crux is getting to 4~ with cool moves past it up and onto the dike.  Two more spaced bolts can be found as you move through easier terrain.
protection: 6 bolts (5/16" Button Heads).  3 Bolt Anchor~ setup for rappel.  With a 60m rope you need to downclimb 4th class for a bit.

location: The Mill > Northeast California > California
desc: Start up a wide chimney which makes you start to wonder what you got yourself into. Then traverse around a corner to the left and begin climbing easier terrain with some gnarly jams up a very steep to overhanging wall. More offwidth brings you to some ass puckering exposure and stemming through a bulge to the top. A two bolt anchor awaits at the top. Two 60m ropes are required to rappel to the ground.
protection: Cams double rack to 4". Single 5" and 6". Nuts~ 1 set.

location: The Western Wall > Western Wall Area > Alabama Hills > Lone Pine Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Start on well-featured bulges to the first clip. Transitions to positive crimps leading up to a crack. Route ends in the small alcove below the headwall.

location: South Mount Klieforth > Buttermilk Crags > Buttermilk Country > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: This route climbs the crack and buckets on the left side of the west face.

location: Deja Vu Pinnacle > Watergate Rock Area > Comic Book Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This is a face climb with some fun runouts~ but overall not very high quality. Rappel to descend.

location: Raven's Roost > Box Canyon East > New Jack City > High Desert > California
desc: This is the right hand route. Starts at a shallow corner and climbs crappy choss past four bolts ( I don't remember).

location: Hunk Rock - East Face > Hunk Rock > Barker Dam Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This is a very dynamic stemming route up an interesting left-facing dihedral just to the right of Soft Cell (5.10c/d). Lots of fun and a good workout. The rock quality is great and a decent is easyily made from the chains atop Soft Cell.
protection: There is a fixed pin and one bolt on the route.  Standard rack from 1/2" to 3".

location: Echo Cove - South Side > Echo Cove > Echo Rock Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This route is between "Ocean of Night" and "Deceptive Corner". Climb to the bolt then swing out left and straight up. I've led this route twice~ and it's a kick in the butt. It's tricky to place pro and somewhat runout. So~if you like a bit of a thrill~ go for it.

location: Shute-Mills Area > The Far Side > Mount St. Helena > Wine Country > San Francisco Bay Area > California
desc: A one move wonder.  Instead of going over the roof immediatly~ follow beneath it on the overly facile climbing until you can clip the second bolt.  Clip it~ then up and over the roof.  Fun move~ boring climb.
protection: 2 bolts to the same 2 bolt anchor as Step To The Left.  Very runout climbing until you get to the roof.  Rope drag will be an even bigger problem than on Stop To The Left

location: North Dallas 40 > Texas Canyon > Angeles National Forest > Los Angeles Basin > California
desc: To the right of buzz killer.     5-6 bolts to chain anchors

location: Raven Rocks North Face "Power Block" Area > Raven Rocks > Box Canyon East > New Jack City > High Desert > California
desc: Go up the dihedral with opportunities for hand and finger jams.

location: Wells Peak / Rabbit Ears > Wheeler Crest > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: The large east face of Wells Peak is divided into an upper and lower half by a thick vertical band of black diorite. December's Children ascends the lower wall via the first continuous crack system to the right of the huge blank face. Excellent rock quality~ but a bit dirty in the cracks - 38 years may have passed between ascents. Approach via Wells Canyon; expect 1.5 hours to the base.      We did a "direct start" and added a technical pitch to the route. It is likely that the FA party traversed into the base of the big chimney (P2) on 3rd/4th class slabs & ledges from the left.    P1) Up double cracks in a short RF corner to lower angle cracks above. Belay at the base of the huge chimney. 5.8 100'    P2) Up the wide and blocky chimney~ step right to belay atop a pillar. Old-school 5.9 150'    P3) Bear-hug the hanging dagger and up a thin-to-hand crack in a corner~ then over a big roof. Belay on blocks~ 5.9+ 120'    P4) Up the short mossy corner to lower-angle hand cracks and chimney. Over another big roof~ then step right to belay at a flake at the base of a LF corner. 5.9 120'    P5) Up the steep and somewhat dirty hands/fists corner for ~50'~ then step right around the arete when things start to look hard. Up and right on ledges to belay atop a pillar. Crux~ 5.10 100'    P6) Continue up cracks right of the huge bushy dihedral~ working to the right when possible. 5.8 120'    P7) Easier blocky cracks lead to the loose diorite ledge atop the wall. 5.7 100'
protection: Doubles to 3"~ single 4"~ stoppers. No fixed gear.

location: 4 - The Shock Block > Table Rock > Mount St. Helena > Wine Country > San Francisco Bay Area > California
desc: Clip the 1st bolt from the ledge~ then step off and right with insta-exposure! Crank up the large holds on alternating vertical and steep terrain till the final slab before the anchors. Classic! There is a 4 bolt Direct Start which starts on a lower tier of rock and goes up a nice dihedral (12 bolts - MUST use a 60M!).
protection: 8 or 12 bolts depending on where you start.

location: Twin Towers > Box Canyon East > New Jack City > High Desert > California
desc: Nice route just left of crack system separating the two towers.  Good protection on great edges.

location: Central Royal Arches > Royal Arches > Royal Arches Area > Valley North Side > Yosemite Valley > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: There are many good finger cracks around the Royal Arches area.  This is one of them:  In a right facing corner is a clean~ straight in~ thin finger tip crack.  Climb this crack with good quality granite 90 ft. to a dirty/bushy ledge.  The quality quickly deteriorates just before reaching the ledge at the top.  Like many of the other cracks in the area~ this pitch is good for climbers just breaking into the grade.
protection: Rack up with thin pro to 2". Rappel from slings around bushes.

location: 1. West Wall > Pigeon Cliff > Northeast California > California
desc: Killer finger crack in a corner to a funky wide stemming dihedral. The crux comes at the top of the finger crack before pulling on to a small ledge. You can climb around the crux using face holds a bit to the left~ which probably clocks in around 5.9.  This route isn't listed in the guidebook that came out in 2014~ but it's hard to believe it hadn't been done previously...if you know of a prior FA~ I'll give the appropriate credit. Regardless~ it's now clean and has its own anchors.
protection: Gear to 3"~ heavier on the small stuff.  Rap anchors.

location: 45 Wall > Lover's Leap (Limestone) > Northeast California > California
desc: Another nice moderate on the 45 Wall.  Look for the finger bucket!

location: Bolt Ladder Area > Gibraltar Area > Santa Barbara > Central Coast > California
desc: Two parallel finger cracks run half way up the right-hand side of the wall.  Both cracks end abruptly at a wide~ horizontal crack/ledge.    Like so many Santa Barbara cracks~ these would be excellent...if only they extended for another 40 feet.
protection: The cracks take small gear (up to 1-inch).  There is no permanent anchor to lower off of.  As such~ this route is almost always top-roped using 2-bolts and a manzanita on the far side of the ledge at the top of the wall.

location: Finger Rake Area > Raker Peak > Lassen National Park > Northeast California > California
desc: Start up a hand and fist crack passing some large bushes to your right and gain the obvious crack system of Raked Over. About 40ft up~ head left up the tips and finger crack that branches off to the left. Follow the finger crack until you can gain the arete. Follow the arete until it ends at a large ledge with a big ol obvious pine tree. Bring slings for the tree.
protection: Cams~ .4 to 3". Nuts 1 set. Offsets useful.

location: South Flank > Daff Dome > Daff Area > Tuolumne Meadows > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: Climb past 2 bolts~ then move right past two more and up a flake to a two bolt belay.   A 5.10a pitch moves left and up past two bolts then right past another bolt~ then up to a two bolt anchor.

location: Sky King Rock > Jumbo Rock Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: This is a clean~ overhanging~ widely flared chimney in a right-facing corner.   The protection is good~ and the moves are aesthetic (if you don't mind chimneys).  Wear kneepads!
protection: standard rack (you can place gear in the back of the chimney)

location: Motherlode Rock - East Face > Motherlode Rock > Central Pinnacles > Holcomb Valley Pinnacles > Big Bear North > Big Bear Lake Area > San Bernardino Mountains > California
desc: The climb begins with a short~ vertical section with side pulls and edges before gaining a high-angle~ somewhat gritty slab reminiscent of Joshua Tree. The crux comes at the third bolt and involves a balancy high-step to better holds.  * This was one of the first routes done on the wall~ and was originally done with a #3 RP (just before the present 3rd bolt)~ two bolts (the third and fourth) and no anchors; it was later retro-bolted to make it more popular and fun.
protection: 4 bolts~ anchor with Mussy hooks (all bolts 1/2" SS)  * Bolts replaced 2019

location: Incinerator Wall > Central Pinnacles > Holcomb Valley Pinnacles > Big Bear North > Big Bear Lake Area > San Bernardino Mountains > California
desc: Start in an alcove and climb interesting and featured face past two bulges with the crux at the very top as a final tricky bulge must be negotiated.  * A long quickdraw on the 4th bolt is highly recommend.

location: Sunshine Face - Right Side > (k) Sunshine Face > Suicide Rock > Tahquitz & Suicide Rocks > California
desc: This route gives an introduction to the steep~ exposed climbing of the Sunshine Face~ at an easier grade than the routes to its left.  Climb the initial section of Buttress Chimney~ then move up and left along a 5.7 ramp (often covered with pine needles) to belay bolts.  The crux pitch follows thin face climbing on great rock~ up and left~ then back right~ finishing at Paisano Ledge.
protection: Bolts plus a light rack (include a few pieces to 3 inches for the belay at the top)

location: (c) Le Dent Pinnacle > Suicide Rock > Tahquitz & Suicide Rocks > California
desc: Follow the short thin crack that curves to the right.  Good climbing~ but it would be much better if the route was longer.

location: Donnell Vista Parking Lot > Upper Highway 108 > Sonora Pass Highway (108) > California
desc: Tricky moves in discontinuous cracks.
protection: Build natural anchors on top after accessing from the right.

location: Upper Wall > Upper Gorge > The Gorge > The Emeralds > Bowman/Emeralds > I-80 Corridor > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Climb the left side of the leftmost section of bolts on the south wall.  The right side of these bolts is called Dam It (5.11b).      This route feels like being in a gym. There are a bunch of pockets and other solid holds up this face route~ and the crux is getting yourself to the first bolt. This route is pretty sustained~ though the route itself is quite enjoyable.    The top section is a little scary traversing to the right over to the anchors.
protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor. You can set up a top rope on the bolts by walking around the top of the Gorge over to the bolts.

location: Overbolted Rock > Split Rocks > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: short thin face~ with balancy moves on very good rock

location: Clock Rock > Benton Crags > Eastern Hills > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Start by climbing to the first bolt of Rock Around The Clock. After passing the bolt~ where Rock Around the Clock moves left along a series of flakes/edges~ instead climb straight up past some bulges to another bolt. A move or two up a slab brings you to a right trending crack~ follow this till you can step up onto the slab above~ and another bolt. Climb the slab past two more bolts then climb directly through the roof on jugs past a final bolt~ then up the plated face above to the anchor for Rock Around the Clock. Either climb the second pitch of Rock Around the Clock or rap (30m rap)
protection: 6 bolts~ plus a few pieces of gear (cams and nuts) to 0.4. You'll want a couple pieces of gear between each of the first 2 bolts~ and then possibly for the upper plates.

location: Thunderbird Wall > Central Pinnacles > Holcomb Valley Pinnacles > Big Bear North > Big Bear Lake Area > San Bernardino Mountains > California
desc: Begin at a smooth slab and climb past two bolts into a right-slanting~ thin crack system. When the crack dies out~ easy face moves on large~ positive holds gain the security of a chain anchor.    Enjoyable climbing with a nice blend of face and crack climbing on this one.

location: The Wild Wild West > Old Castle > North San Diego County > San Diego County > California
desc: This is the radical dirty birdshit covered right facing corner~ capped by a roof in which you traverse out left via a perfect horizontal hand crack. When it become possible to mantle up out of roof into shallow chossy dish/corner there is one pod in middle of dish that takes a .5 I believe?   From here make a couple moves and climb unbelievable Finger crack/right trending flake!!!

location: The Pyramid > Rattlesnake Canyon > Indian Cove > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: High Tops ascends the clean dihedral to the crux undercling on the main face of the Pyramid. Undercling left to where you can cross the roof (balancy) to slightly incipient cracks on the face above. Make easier moves up and right to a good crack. A ways up the good crack face holds lead out left (unprotected) to a hanging belay (Todd Swain 5.11 face route) and rappel station. The FA apparently continued up the crack to the top.

location: Gas and Electric Crag > Bowman Valley > Bowman/Emeralds > I-80 Corridor > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: Climbs past some old rods and cables coming out of the cliff. Climb in to the blast hole and grab the concrete and iron jug footing. Stay left of the hanging cable.

location: Eagle's Nest (Upper) > Eagles Nest > Big Sleep Area > Shuteye Ridge > Southern Sierra > California
desc: Climb the stack and then teeter on a reach to climb first bolt. Climb the runnel~ mostly staying on the right side. I did a combination side pull counter pressure technique to keep the left foot strong while inching up. Many small depressions for feet. Finish on a 5.fun ladder of knobs.
protection: 3 bolts~ one optional cam placement~ 1-2 chicken heads. Rings on bolted anchor.

location: Smooth Sole Wall - Left Side > (h) Smooth Sole Walls > Suicide Rock > Tahquitz & Suicide Rocks > California
desc: This climb follows a very thin crack on the far left side of the wall.  It would be difficult to place gear in the upper part of the crack.  However~ it's a fun route~ and you can toprope it.  There are some thin lieback moves on the upper section.
protection: many thin pieces to 1/2"~ 2 bolt anchor

location: Pitstop > Lower Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Climb the left-leaning crack past a roof to a face above.
protection: 2 bolts~ gear to 3.5"~ shared anchor with "Pitstop".

location: Flavin Haven > Upper Gorge > Owens River Gorge > Bishop Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: Excellent climb~ one of the best of its grade in the Gorge. Mantle up past two bolts heading right to a wide step-across to the left. Crimp and smear up a slabby section to a small ramp to the left. Lieback around and up to the dihedral and then straight up to the anchors.

location: Gettin' Western Corridor > The Corridors > Cattle Pocket and Corridors Area > Alabama Hills > Lone Pine Area > Sierra Eastside > California
desc: If I recall correctly~ the crux section seems to be between bolts 2 & 3.  The holds are perfect (especially at the crux...look right)!  All in all~ it's a fun .10a in the shade!
protection: 3 bolts to a set of mussy hooks

location: East Face > Tuolumne Peak > May Lake Area > Tuolumne Meadows > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: Climb the dual crack systems. The obvious headwall presents the significant difficulty. Sadly~ the rock quality at the crux is not top-notch as the rest of the climb is. The cracks top out at the bottom of the rightmost upper gully system; scramble to the trees and talus.

location: Loggerhead Buttress > El Cap Picnic Area > Valley North Side > Yosemite Valley > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: This climb is mostly hand jams but takes all sizes of pro.  The jams are awkward but solid~ and good for warming up on if you plan to climb some of the harder lines in the area.
protection: Standard rack plus extra 2-3 inch pieces.  Two bolt anchor.

location: Rich And Famous Cliff > Big Hunk > Echo Rock Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: Bolted face route with supplemental gear that starts directly underneath the upper crack of The Art Of The Deal~ but veers right before that upper crack and stays to its right toward the topout.
protection: 6 bolts~ plus small to medium cams.  Bolted rap anchor.

location: Eagle Lake Cliff > Eagle Creek Canyon > West Shore > Lake Tahoe > California
desc: A good warmup for the cliff~ this climb will help dial the feet a bit and provide a bit of reprieve from the relentless jamming shenanigans the rest of the area delivers.    It is a bit sporty going from the 1st to 2nd bolts~ but this is also very easy terrain. The crux is some balancy knob pulling located between the 2nd and 3rd bolts.
protection: 3 bolts to a rap anchor shared with Master of Disaster

location: Moving to Montana Boulder > Lost Horse Area > Joshua Tree National Park > California
desc: A beautiful overhanging splitter. Pumpy and clean.

location: West Face > Clouds Rest > Valley South Side > Yosemite Valley > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: Every Tuolumne climber has eyed the huge face of clouds rest.  Then~ one day I found a description on the internet of an awesome sounding route right up the middle.  With 2700 feet of 5.9ish climbing~ it sounded too good to be true.  Finally in 2009 we went out and did the route and it has become one of my favorite climbs in Yosemite.    Tom Harper had a great topo here: (deadlink)myweb.cableone.net/tomharper/FTTopo dot html   My Favorite Things topo    The pitches are almost all 55-60m long~ ending in two beefy bolt anchors~ and the "official" ratings are:    1: 5.5   2: 5.8   3: 5.8   4: 5.7   5: 5.7   6: 5.7   7: 5.8   8: 5.9   9: 5.9   10: 5.7   11: 5.10a   12: 5.9   13: 5.7   14: 5.8   15: 5.9    I think these ratings are slightly soft~ but considering the amount of climbing~ you need to be solid at the grade to make it happen in a day.    With a 6 mile cross country approach~ 2700 feet of climbing~ 1200 feet of 3rd to the top and 7 miles back to the car~ it is a burly~ rewarding day.
protection: All anchors have two bolts.  Almost all the pitches require a 60m rope.  The first 10 pitches can be rapped without leaving any gear.  There are bolts here and there~ but it is mostly trad gear~ with emphasis on small to finger size.

location: Penny Royal Arches > Tuolumne Meadows > Yosemite National Park > California
desc: A runout route put up in old-school Tuolumne tradition.  What's the opposite of 'vision'?    Pitch 1 - climb the discontinuous finger crack(5.7) to a two bolt anchor with quick links and chain.    Pitch 2 - head slightly right and up past two closely spaced bolts then up and right(5.10a) over a small roof to a third bolt.  Climb 20-25 feet to a two-bolt anchor.    Pitch 3 - climb up and slightly right past three bolts(5.10a) to the two-bolt anchor which is shared by Diaphoretic Spasms.
protection: Stoppers and small stuff up to 1" for the finger crack on pitch 1.  Bolts after that.

location: Shute-Mills Area > The Far Side > Mount St. Helena > Wine Country > San Francisco Bay Area > California
desc: An interesting yet not sustained 5.10a to the left of the odvious chimney left of Saviour Heart.  Lots of lateral movement makes this climb through provoking and exciting on lead.
protection: Three bolts to a 3 bolts anchor atop the rock~ bring long slings to top rope~ which can be accessed by going around and up way to the right.In classic Far Side fashion~ only the harder moves are bolted.

location: Plumas Slab > Grizzly Dome > Northeast California > California
desc: Originally rated PG13~ the consensus among the few who have climbed it in the past years is R. The line remains dirty~ can be wet for months~ and is a challenge at 10.a.    All of that said~ this is a really good line~ almost solid smearing w/few 'holds'.     Head straight up from the belay towards the mini roof/step. First bolt is 15'+~ and it is heady pulling over the step. Pass 2 more bolts ad then be prepared for 20' of unrelenting 5.10 smear-fest. Just don't think about the fall potential~ the roof below~ of the dirt and munge.

location: Peeper's Rock > Mickey's Beach > San Francisco Bay Area > California
desc: The crux of this climb is at the very beginning. From the adjacent boulder~ grab the left-facing sidepull~ find a good right hand and  then immediately pull through an overhang to get onto Peeper's Rock. A left heel hook can help. From this opening move it's about 15 feet down to the ground/tide. Don't look down if the thought of that fall scares you.  The main face above the first bolt is much easier~ until an interesting move or two between the last bolt and the anchor. If you're stuck~ look to the right of the last bolt to find better hands.  The moves off the deck are the fun/hard part - rope or otherwise~ it's a little invigorating to step of a ledge and onto an overhang above a treacherous fall.  One can start this route from the sand up the cave below~ but this adds a V6 bouldering problem (that is very difficult to protect) before the main start of the climb.
protection: 3 newish glue-in bolts to a two bolt anchor with a rap ring. This route previously had OLD bolts that were slowly rusting away.  A stick clip is strongly recommended to clip the first bolt before leading this climb~ or a person taller than 6'3" might be able to reach it by hand. Without pre-clipping the first bolt this climb is rated R~ given that the start is the crux and sits above a nasty 15-foot fall to a rocky landing.  You can also easily set up a top rope after doing the (stiff) 5.9 on the East Face~ Peeping Tom.

location: West Point > Lake Arrowhead Pinnacles > Lake Arrowhead Area > San Bernardino Mountains > California
desc: Start in a crack~ traverse left to a bolted face.
protection: Gear to 3 bolts~ two chain anchor.

location: West Point > Lake Arrowhead Pinnacles > Lake Arrowhead Area > San Bernardino Mountains > California
desc: The sport climb variation of Natasha.

location: Hooker Boot Wall > Snow Play Walls > Running Springs Area > San Bernardino Mountains > California
